Pre-Game Insights: The Men in Blue have dominated the home World Cup with three wins out of three games.
Bangladesh suffered its second consecutive defeat in the tournament after losing to New Zealand by seven wickets in Chennai.
Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan could miss the game in Pune due to a fitness issue as he was diagnosed with a quad tear.
The MCA Stadium in Pune has produced great batting tracks with an average score of 305, favoring batters but offering some movement for fast bowlers and spinners.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's batting and bowling departments have been in excellent form.
Bangladesh's batting and bowling have been their biggest letdowns so far.

SportsTiger Playing XI of India: Rohit Sharma (c), Shubman Gill, Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer, KL Rahul (wk), Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Shardul Thakur, Kuldeep Yadav, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj.

SportsTiger Playing XI of Bangladesh: Litton Das, Tanzid Hasan, Mehidy Hasan Miraz, Najmul Hossain Shanto (c), Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), Towhid Hridoy, Mahmudullah, Taskin Ahmed, Mahedi Hasan, Mustafizur Rahman, Shoriful Islam.
